text.content:
REASON FOR VISIT/CHIEF COMPLAINT:   Acute problem(s) 

  chest pain.

SOURCE(S) OF HISTORY: Patient 
 
Computerized Problem List is the source for the following: 
 
1. Obesity, Onset 00/00/04                            05/30/12 
AVIVAUSER,THIRT
2. Hyperlipidemia                                     09/22/09  PROVIDER,ONE 
3. Diabetes Mellitus Type II or unspecified, Onset    05/10/12  PROVIDER,ONE 
00/00/05 
     Adequate control on oral medications.
     Goal to lose 50 pounds in 1 year.
4. Osteopenia, Onset 00/00/08                         11/19/08  PROVIDER,ONE 
5. Postsurgical hypothyroidism, Onset 00/00/02        05/10/12  PROVIDER,ONE 
     Complete thryoidectomy for thyroid cancer in 2002.
6. Depression, Onset 00/00/08                         11/19/08  PROVIDER,ONE 
7. Hypertension, Onset 00/00/05                       11/09/08  PROVIDER,ONE 


SOCIAL HISTORY: 
    HABITS: 
      ALCOHOL? No alcohol in past year 
      TOBACCO? Ex-tobacco user 
      ILLICIT DRUGS? Never used. 
  MARITAL/DOMESTIC STATUS: 
    Living arrangements:   with spouse/partner 
    Married.

MEDICATIONS:
Active Inpatient and Outpatient Medications (including Supplies):
 

     Outpatient Medications                                 Status
=========================================================================
1)   ASPIRIN 81MG EC TAB TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY     ACTIVE
       DAY
2)   CALCIUM CARBONATE 1.25GM (CA 500MG) TAB TAKE 500 MG    ACTIVE
       BY MOUTH THREE TIMES A DAY
3)   CHLORTHALIDONE 25MG TAB TAKE 12.5 MG  BY MOUTH EVERY   ACTIVE
       DAY
4)   ERGOCALCIFEROL 1000 UNIT CAP TAKE 1000 UNITS BY MOUTH  ACTIVE
       EVERY DAY
5)   GLYBURIDE 2.5MG TAB TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY     ACTIVE
       DAY
6)   LEVOTHYROXINE NA (SYNTHROID) 0.125MG TAB TAKE ONE      ACTIVE
       TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY DAY
7)   LISINOPRIL 20MG TAB TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY     ACTIVE
       DAY
8)   SIMVASTATIN 80MG TAB TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY    ACTIVE
       EVENING
9)   VENLAFAXINE HCL 75MG SA CAP TAKE THREE CAPSULES BY     ACTIVE
       MOUTH DAILY
 
9 Total Medications

ALLERGIES/ADRS:
METFORMIN, CITALOPRAM, FLUOXETINE


  Patient/family state(s):  No new allergies


REVIEW OF SYSTEMS 
 Review of Systems
 Constitutional:
  (-)Negative for: 
    Fevers, chills, weakness, nights sweats and weight change
 Cardiac:
      Chest pain, HTN.  no diaphoresis.
 Respiratory:
  (-)Negative for (Patient denies symptoms of): 
    Cough, Wheeze, Dyspnea, DOE
 GI/Digestive:
  (+)Positive symptoms reported: 
    change in appetite
  (-)Negative for (Patient denies symptoms of): 
    heartburn, abdominal pain, diarrhea
 Neurologic:
  (-)Negative for (Patient denies symptoms of): 
    Headaches, dizziness, convulsions, memory loss, paralysis, loss of 
        consciousness

PHYSICAL EXAMINATION:
 
VITAL SIGNS:
            B/P:  141/91 (07/09/2013 11:11)
          Pulse:  99 (07/09/2013 11:11)
    Temperature:  101 F [38.3 C] (07/09/2013 11:11)
   Respirations:  20 (07/09/2013 11:11)
         Weight:  231 lb [105.0 kg] (07/03/2013 15:13)
         Height:  64 in [162.6 cm] (11/20/2012 16:31)
            BMI:  40
           Pain:  10 (07/09/2013 11:11)


  APPEARANCE:  NAD 

  EYE EXAM - 
    PUPILS:  PERRLA. 
    RIGHT EYE: Not examined 
    LEFT EYE:  Not examined 
  THYROID: No thyromegaly. 
  NECK:  Supple.
  CERVICAL ADENOPATHY: Absent.
  THORAX/CHEST:Not examined 
  LUNG AUSCULTATION: Clear 
  LUNG PERCUSSION: 
  CARDIOVASCULAR -
    NECK VEINS: Not examined.
    HEART-PMI: 
    INSPECTION: Not examined
    RYTHYM:     Regular 
    AUSCULTATION:  No gallop 
    No murmur 
    No edema. 
  ABDOMEN: 
    Appearance:   Flat.
    Palpation:    Soft, tender 
    No organomegaly, No masses 
    Bowel sounds: Normal. 

  RECTAL:  Not Examined.
  NEUROLOGIC EXAM - 
    CRANIAL NERVES: Normal
    MOTOR EXAM: Normal 
    SENSORY:    Normal
 
  PSYCHIATRIC: 
           JUDGMENT: Poor
            INSIGHT: Poor
        ORIENTATION: Oriented X3 
               MOOD: Depressed
      RECENT MEMORY: Good
      REMOTE MEMORY: Good


Subjective, Assessment and Plan:

1. Depression with suicidal thoughts.

-S: The pt describes feeling chest pain, and is clearly anxious.  no pain relief 
from first nitro, EKG neg. 

-A/P: will watch for trop, chem 7 and cbc results.  Morphine, ASA.  already on 
O2 @ 6L/min.
text.author: AVIVAUSER,SEVEN
